definitions.definition: an item of sweet food made from a mixture of well-beaten egg whites and sugar, baked until crisp and typically used as a topping for desserts, especially pies. Individual meringues are often filled with fruit or whipped cream.
a Caribbean style of dance music typically in duple and triple time, chiefly associated with Dominica and Haiti.
a style of dancing associated with merengue music, with alternating long and short stiff-legged steps.
